review_body: I take an herbal or homeopathic sleep aid every night, since I tend to need a little help to nudge me over the edge into dreamland.  I use a few different products which I rotate every three days, since that seems to keep their effects potent.  I had never tried wild lettuce or California poppy extract before.  I'm happy to say that taking two of these capsules before bedtime has been VERY effective at helping me get to sleep.  I mean they work like a dang charm!  I could almost believe these had THAT kind of poppy in them (they do no actually have that kind of poppy. 🙂)  I'm happy to have these on hand, as they have proven so far to be a surefire knockout inducer.  I still need to resort to something more powerful if I've had caffeine or B vitamins too late in the day, but for everyday use these are a winner.

review_body: This was my very first experience with wild lettuce and poppyseed and I'm pleasantly surprised at how effective they are for me.  I struggle with a lot of chronic pain that is made worse by tension and anxiety, it's like a vicious cycle so I wanted to find something to help break that cycle and hopefully help my body and mind relax.  I decided to give these a try and I am super glad I did.  The first time I took these I started to relax and my muscles started to loosen and some of the pain eased up and in turned eased my mind.....these are now a regular supplement, especially while I wait to be scheduled for hip replacement (yeah....ouch).  I sleep better now and that helps immensely!  I'll be back for more!

review_title: Potential Benefits: Relaxation, Sleep, Mood, Comfort, Calming, Quality, Dosage, Wellness
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2024
review_body: This Wild Lettuce and California Poppy Seed Extract offers a high-potency blend designed to support relaxation and aid in sleep. Each bottle contains 120 capsules, each packed with a potent combination of wild lettuce and California poppy seed extracts. This formula is tailored for those seeking natural relief from discomfort and enhanced relaxation.The capsules feature a strong dosage, with each serving providing 560 mg of wild lettuce extract and 40 mg of California poppy seed extract. The use of extract forms of these herbs allows for a higher concentration of their active ingredients, which can enhance their effectiveness compared to standard forms.Wild lettuce is well-regarded for its soothing properties and is commonly used to help alleviate discomfort and promote better sleep. Its calming effects make it a popular choice for those struggling with restlessness or minor discomfort that disrupts their sleep.California poppy, on the other hand, has a long history of use in traditional medicine for its ability to promote physical and mental relaxation. It can help in enhancing mood and providing relief from physical discomfort, making it a valuable addition to the formula for overall well-being.From my experience with these capsules, I found them to be somewhat effective in promoting relaxation and aiding in sleep. The high dosage of wild lettuce and California poppy seemed to work well in calming the mind and easing discomfort, which contributed to slightly better sleep quality. The vegetarian capsules were a bonus, ensuring that the supplement aligns with plant-based preferences.The capsules are manufactured in the USA in a GMP-certified facility, ensuring a high standard of quality and adherence to strict policies.Overall, Parker Naturals’ Wild Lettuce and California Poppy Seed Extract Capsules offer a potent, natural option for those seeking enhanced relaxation and sleep support. The high concentration of active ingredients and the vegetarian formulation make this a noteworthy choice for addressing discomfort and promoting restful sleep. It helped me a little, but not enough to purchase more. Others may see more pronounced benefits as everyone is different.Consulting a healthcare provider before starting any new supplement is advisable. Keep well (:

review_title: Works great for sleep and mild anxiety
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2015
review_body: I researched California Poppy in regard to anxiety and trouble sleeping. I was prescribed a mild dose of Xanax to help because I have reoccurring stress dreams all night long that prevent me from getting good sleep. I wasn't comfortable with that so I started checking around and found this. I have been using it for only 1 week but I really notice a difference. I haven't taken the anti anxiety med or melatonin (another failed attempt) and I feel pretty good. I track my sleep with a Jawbone device and this has added at least 2 additional hours of solid sleep to my night. The dreams are lucid but not too crazy and it's a nice break from the usual 'I'm behind on this and it needs to be done now!' dreams. I don't wake up groggy and I can use it throughout the day for general anxiety and It doesn't  do anything but take the edge off. I don't even notice that part, I just realize at the end of the day the job seamed easier. I gave some to my husband to try and he had a crazy dream that left him rattled, so it's probably not for everyone but for me it works.

review_title: Terrible taste, great sleep, pick and choose!

I will try to add to tea as it works for sleep. But I don't want to burn my mouth so if it doesn't work drinking then I will have to find something else.

features: Expertly extracted to provide calming support to the nervous system | Prepared from certified organic, fresh whole Eschschoizia californica plants grown on our own southern Oregon farms | Gluten-free and non-GMO | Gentle enough to use with children | Herb potency assured through High Performance Thin Layer Chromatography (HPTLC) analysis
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 28, 2017
review_body: I have used this as sleep enhancing remedy for several months and find it quite effective. I tried Californai Poppy capsules and they do not do the job. I take one dropper full  of this extract in a cup of chamomile tea about an hour before sleep. Straight chamomile does nothing. The poppy  seems to help me wake up on time and be more alert, not over sleep, so it may be helping the quality of  sleep. I dislike the high alcohol level and the taste is truly vile, that is the reason for four stars. Herb Pharm has proved to be a reliable company of quality extracts but they don't make California Poppy in a glycerin, non alcohol form. I still recommend this and suggest putting it in an herb tea to avoid the taste.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 12, 2023
review_body: I’ve been using various Herb Phrm products for years. Used to buy at Whole Foods but was more expensive. Now that I’m in menopause, hot flashes really interrupt my nights! I’ve found that using a dropper of this at bedtime helps me sleep a bit better. It’s not a cure all and I still don’t get a full night of rest. I’ll wake up in a few hours but then use a dropper of the Herb Pharm Valerian to help me back to sleep. Middle age women have to do what we can!

features: Expertly extracted to provide calming support to the nervous system | Prepared from certified organic, fresh whole Eschschoizia californica plants grown on our own southern Oregon farms | Gluten-free and non-GMO | Gentle enough to use with children | Herb potency assured through High Performance Thin Layer Chromatography (HPTLC) analysis
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2016
review_body: I have a very high tolerance for benzodiazepines from years of being prescribed for insomnia, so I researched my problem and landed on studies of  Eschscholzia californica.  As others have stated in the reviews here - every person is unique, and no two people will experience the same effects.  With this in mind I read all the reviews and saw that people either had a good result or very little result and thought I'd try it for my severe chronic insomnia and see if it helped me.  After laying awake for 4 hours I took it (exactly as the label instructs) at 2:45am.  When I was still awake an hour later and got up to use the bathroom I was very startled to find I suddenly had severe double vision and a really unpleasant sensation in the front of my head.  After returning to bed I essentially blacked out for about 45 minutes and then snapped wide awake (where I stayed the rest of the night).  Fortunately for me the double vision passed in about 3 more hours.  I spent the next day with a headache and the realization that supplements like this are completely unregulated and I had NO IDEA what I had actually consumed when I took this product. The ingredients indicated on the label are "Alcohol 62%" and distilled water.  Perhaps it's wood alcohol? That might explain the bad visual disturbance and unpleasant headache.  I'm thankful my vision returned to normal the next day, as I could've experienced permanent damage from consuming a liquid made and sold by an unknown entity in an industry that has zero oversight.  Final word on this stuff: take at your own risk.  If the severe visual disturbance I experienced from it hadn't passed... I hate to imagine.  And 45 minutes of sleep for the night wasn't my goal. I threw the bottle in the trash the next day.  THINK TWICE ABOUT WHAT YOU MIGHT BE CONSUMING BEFORE TAKING THIS PRODUCT.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2012
review_body: I saw the many positive reviews on here and read some various literature online touting the wonderful relaxing effects of California poppy extract. I ordered a bottle and I have to say it was a complete waste of money. It had a strong, bitter alcohol taste (considering it is mixed with alcohol) that was difficult to mask, even when I boiled it in water to boil off some of the alcohol and added it to my tea. Since I use herbal extracts to relax, I am always on the lookout for new, helpful herbal remedies. For instance, I find passionflower and valerian extracts to be very effective. After reading about California poppy being a relaxant, pain reliever, etc. I had pretty high expectations. I have to say I was disappointed. Only after taking twice the suggested dosage did I feel a little relaxed, and even so, it was nowhere near as effective as valerian or passionflower. I did not have any interesting or lucid dreams, and it did nothing for pain. I suppose it works for some people, but it definitely didn't do a thing for me.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2024
review_body: I bought this to add to a herbal sleep remedy. I find that it works very well, it has certainly improved the quality of my sleep. Like most herbal remedies it takes a while to work. ( i don,t think that there are any quick fixes in herbal medicine)  The quality, i have used a number of tinctures from this company and they all seem to be of high quality, i have every confidence in them. As for the taste, most herbal tinctures taste awful. (why would anyone think it would taste nice?) However the taste is not that bad and is quite easily masked in a drink of some sort. If you are suffering with insomnia and/or anxiety, this is well worth a try. It is more effective mixed with other calming herbs than on its own though.

review_title: This is like a miracle herb
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2022
review_body: I don’t notice the taste as I either dilute it or put it in an empty capsule, but honestly, even if it tasted like raw chicken feet, I’d still take it for how it makes me feel - completely relaxed and sleeping like a baby.I used to take melatonin for sleep, but I noticed that I felt groggy in the morning, but with this supplement, none of this happens. And I don’t even remember falling asleep.As a female, I also noticed that my periods are much lighter when I take it. And less painful.  Fantastic stuff.

review_title: Can cause the exact symptoms you're trying to quell
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 7, 2023
review_body: At first, I thought this product was working well. California poppy activates the GABA receptors in the brain. GABA helps to calm the body and the mind, and counterbalances the neurotransmitter called “glutamate” which excites the body's central and peripheral nervous systems.However, too much GABA can cause the exact symptoms you are trying to prevent! This is what happened to me after 4 nights of taking 1ml of this product at night. I experienced anxiety (with a tight chest), restlessness, and slight shortness of breath. At first, I thought the symptoms I was trying to fix were just getting worse, so I increased my dose a little bit, but my symptoms got worse. This is when I realised the product was making me feel worse.Be mindful of your dosage and keep track your symptoms. If you don’t feel any better, maybe you are too sensitive and you’re increasing GABA too much like I experienced.I know the product caused this feeling because I’ve taken GABA powder in the past and felt the exact same thing when I no longer required it my body started reacting badly.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2024
review_body: These California poppy supplements do make me feel a bit relaxed and chilled out, but it's quite subtle, you almost don't notice it unless you're really paying attention to how you're feeling. I took two the other day and the feeling was a bit more pronounced, but still not too strong. It did help me fall asleep and I think it helped me stay asleep too, although I did feel a bit groggy when I woke up the next day. Overall I'm pretty satisfied, it's nice to take a little edge off every now and then.

review_title: Good for sleep but lacking in some ways
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2024
review_body: Overall, I agree with other reviews that it doesn't offer enough information on the bottle, including directions. The tablets themselves are easy to swallow and don't taste bad. I struggle sleeping so I gave these a go and did notice relaxing more into a nice sleep. They didn't actually make me sleepy, but instead just settled my thoughts so I could nod off more easily.

review_title: Because I’m not familiar with the use of poppy I wish they provided more information on the regimen
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2024
review_body: Because I don’t sleep well and have a difficult time relaxing this supplement caught my attention.  It is a 30 day supply (assuming 1 tablet a day but the bottle does say you can take up to 4) for under $10 (at the time of this review). I am never used poppy before so I don’t know exactly how I should use it and wish they provided better direction.  It doesn’t say to use it before bed and doesn’t warn about using it while driving or doing other things that require your attention.  I am taking one in the morning and it is too soon to see if I feel more relaxed during the day or sleep better.  I put a photo against another bottle to show that it comes in a bottle about half the size of other bottles.  I applaud the company for this as too often you get a lot of unnecessary packaging and this company seems to be sensitive to that issue.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2024
review_body: I really wanted to like these and really wanted to be impressed with its effects. But that just wasn't the case for me. The only thing I noticed with these tablets is that I felt sleepy. But I'm unsure to if that was placebo or perhaps I was just genuinely tired. I've tried other products made by this brand, and just about every product I've tried has extremely small text on the bottle. It is difficult to read the dosage information and content information. I don't know why they can't just increase the size of the font, but it's been a little frustrating.

description: California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) is a typical species of herbaceous plants of the genus Eschscholzia. The stem is straight or branched, smooth, sometimes bluish in color. The root is rod, powerful. A flower is solitary with yellow to orange petals. California Poppy blooms from February to September. The flower closes at night and in cold windy weather, and opens again in the morning, but may remain closed if it is cloudy weather.

description: California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) is a typical species of herbaceous plants of the genus Eschscholzia. The stem is straight or branched, smooth, sometimes bluish in color. The root is rod, powerful. A flower is solitary with yellow to orange petals. California Poppy blooms from February to September. The flower closes at night and in cold windy weather, and opens again in the morning, but may remain closed if it is cloudy weather. Valerian Root also known as Valeriana officinalis. Common Valerian, European Valerian, Valeriana and Allheal. Valerian is a perennial plant, native to Europe and parts of Asia. It grows in meadows and woodlands within moist, temperate climates and has since been naturalized in North America. The root system consists of a vertical rhizome and an abundance of smaller rootlets which are harvested and dried at temperatures less than 105 degrees Fahrenheit.

Really the BEST California Poppy and Valerian root extract on market!

review_title: Use As Intended - Sleep, Relaxation, and Tim Ferriss. (Note - This Is Not For Pain)
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2015
review_body: I feel I have to leave a review here to give more of a balanced perspective on this product instead of the other reviews you're likely seeing from people that didn't do a whole lot of research before buying this product.TL:DR - Use this for relaxation and sleep. It's not an instant drowsiness but rather it feels as if you're naturally progressing towards sleep over 30-60min. DO NOT DRINK IT STRAIGHT. Take it with something sweet like orange juice. 15-20 drops outta do it. Also, the effects take longer to kick in if you take this and then continue to stare at a TV or computer screen.Detailed Background: My curiosity around California Poppy Seed Extract (CPSE) came from Tim Ferriss and his findings in The 4 Hour Body. There seemed to be some evidence that CPSE has some benefits around REM sleep. As someone who has trouble sleeping and wants to reduce the amount of sleep I need every day, this piqued my interest. So I went online, looked through a few academic papers, and pestered a few relatives that were pharmacists and doctors about this. Turns out, Tim's findings do hold some weight (although more rigorous studies and testing are definitely needed).I've been using this product for about 2-3 years now and I haven't had any issues. To be safe, I took Tim's advice and I stop taking this every three months for the duration of one month. And I've gone from using this every night to maybe 2-3 times a week and that's typically if I know I'm not going to get at least 6 hours of sleep. The boost to REM sleep definitely helps.I think one of the biggest takeaways is this isn't, at least in my case, an addictive substance and it doesn't have seem to have any significant side effects (unlike many major pharmaceutical products). If anything, it helped to train my body to get a regular sleep cycle and how to relax before bed. So that, even when I stop taking this for a month at a time, I still get a decent amount of sleep.So in short, the product works if you use it as intended. If you did zero research and you're going off the claims of Dr.Oz...frankly...you're kind of an idiot. Never trust one source, especially a celebrity. This doesn't magically cure pain. At least to my knowledge, I've never experienced it or come across any research that indicates that unless it's a placebo effect.Use this for sleep and relaxation, that's all. And if you want more info or struggle with either of those topics then I'd recommend taking a look through The 4 Hour Body. Several other tips there that have helped me out over the years.

review_title: Works well for minor pain or sleep problems
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2013
review_body: I'm still experimenting with dose but found even 7 or 8 drops directly to the tongue impart a gentle sedation for minor pain or sleep problems. The effect increases with larger dosage but I can see going through this wee bottle very quickly if you have moderate pain and need 20 or 30 drops. The effects fade after a couple hours. I wouldn't be comfortable using this at work or while driving as it makes me a little listless and sleepy.It tastes terrible--like fermented lawn clippings--but gets maximum effect dropped directly on my tongue. Even mixed in tea I can taste it but it blends in okay. I added it to a shot of Jack Daniels and the taste completely disappeared and made for a great nightcap on a restless night. Both poppy extract and a few bong loads of wild lettuce have proved to be effective for my occasional sleep or minor pain problems.

review_title: Was surprised by Poppy Extract effectiveness.
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2013
review_body: There are many products available which induce sleep in a variety of ways. The type of sleep also varies, as sleep comes at several different levels. Having grown California Poppies for decorative purposes, I was not aware of a medicinal application, and so I was somewhat dubious regarding effectiveness. This product did produce sleep when taken as directed. I used the product intermittently several times with similar results. The sleep was hypnotic in nature and without dreams. There was some residual grogginess the following day, but it was not intolerable. The product was not overly offensive to take with an interesting herb-like aroma and taste. So this California Poppy extract would be effective for occasional sleepless nights. I cannot offer an opinion about long term results.

review_body: When I first took this I was confused because it says for sleep. The 1st night I had a wild dream, The 2nd night, I noticed I awoke and was so rested. Not tired. I continued to take it, but thought it was making my heart race (which it wasn't) so i stopped taking it. I began to get stiff and sore as I awoke and it hit me that after the week I had taken it I was pain free. I then remembered it was for pain as one of "DR OZ'S so called expert had mentioned on the things drug companies DON'T want you to know. I have to say this one did the control the pain!

description: California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) is a typical species of herbaceous plants of the genus Eschscholzia. The stem is straight or branched, smooth, sometimes bluish in color. The root is rod, powerful. A flower is solitary with yellow to orange petals. California Poppy blooms from February to September. The flower closes at night and in cold windy weather, and opens again in the morning, but may remain closed if it is cloudy weather. Saint John's Wort (Hypericum Perforatum) is a perennial herbaceous plant up to 30 - 100 cm high. The stalk is dihedral bare in the upper part is oppositely branched. Rhizomes and roots are underdeveloped, unbranched. The leaves are oval or ovoid, with translucent glands in the form of black dots. Petals are strewn with black-brown or purple dots, especially around the edge. The plant blooms in June-August. The fruit is a three-celled oblong-ovate capsule. Seeds are small, cylindrical, brown. The fruits ripen in September-October.

Kava Kava (Piper Methysticum) is an upright, dioecious, evergreen shrub that grows to 10-15’ tall with heart-shaped glossy dark green leaves. It grows on a number of South Pacific islands (Micronesia, Fiji, Hawaii, New Guinea, the Samoas, Tonga and Vanuatu), but the specific place of origin is unknown. Male plants produce short cylindrical spikes of small creamy white flowers, but female plants rarely flower.

brand: HawaiiPharm California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) and Kava Kava (Piper Methysticum) Liquid Extract 4 oz
name: HawaiiPharm California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) and Kava Kava (Piper Methysticum) Liquid Extract 4 oz
description: California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) is a typical species of herbaceous plants of the genus Eschscholzia. The stem is straight or branched, smooth, sometimes bluish in color. The root is rod, powerful. A flower is solitary with yellow to orange petals. California Poppy blooms from February to September. The flower closes at night and in cold windy weather, and opens again in the morning, but may remain closed if it is cloudy weather. Kava Kava (Piper Methysticum) is an upright, dioecious, evergreen shrub that grows to 10-15’ tall with heart-shaped glossy dark green leaves. It grows on a number of South Pacific islands (Micronesia, Fiji, Hawaii, New Guinea, the Samoas, Tonga and Vanuatu), but the specific place of origin is unknown. Male plants produce short cylindrical spikes of small creamy white flowers, but female plants rarely flower.

Really the BEST California Poppy and Kava Kava extract on market!

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2023
review_body: I love plant allies and how they can help us move through things. California poppy can soothe your nervous system. In the wake of a challenging situation, my emotions today were very weighty. I feel sad most of the day, and used the poppy tea for the first time this evening. I feel calm, gentle and at peace. Even a little fuzzy, which is not a great description for some people but it explains how I feel. The taste is somewhat grassy, and almost has a warm mouth feel (not like licorice root, way more subtle). I enjoyed it, and I’m enjoying the relaxing feeling of it now.

review_title: Not a loose leaf tea: see the difference on the photos leaf vs no leaf
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2023
review_body: This is not a "loose leaf tea" as advertised but pieces of stems without a single leaf or flower.  I enclosed a photo of my old loose leaf ( almost finished) tea beside what I received from Nelson.  You can see for yourself.  Despite the evidence, the seller denied the deceitful advertisement and denied my returning his loose stems ( for obvious reason).  When a seller denies a return, the seller does not refund.  Amazon did reimburse me with their A to Z policy.  Be aware of this and try finding a real loose leaf tea of California Poppy.  It's a wonderful tea when the leaves are there.

review_title: Small product, HUGE free sample… why?

review_title: BEST Sleep Aid I've Tried (Out of Tons)
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2021
review_body: This product is absolutely amazing. Look no further for a healthy natural and organic sleep aid. Effective, Taste Good, High Quality, Reasonable Price, and the company selling it seems ethical. Great energy. I wish this would come up when people searched sleep aid on Amazon, but unfortunately right now you need to search pretty specifically to find it.Read full review for more details.-I have had sleep issues since I was a teenager (30s now). A long time ago I took Ambien, but later switched to herbal remedies to get away from the dangers and downsides of that medication. I've tried everything I think is available such as; Catnip, Chamomile, Valerian, and California Poppy, various tinctures, teas, and pills containing them or other relaxing plants over the years.Out of them I found Valerian and Poppy to be the most effective on separate occasions (don't underestimate a strong Catnip tea though), but I had never tried them together so I ordered this product. It is very effective as expected, though with my sleep issues I do sometimes need more than the recommended .75ml. That's okay, it's a large bottle and at a price I find acceptable for such a high quality product. We'll see how long it lasts and I'll update the review, but based on my math it should last about 3 months taking a double dose, 6 months if you have only mild sleep trouble or are tiny like my partner.Oh, and, if you are aware that Poppy and Valerian both taste or smell awful - forget about it. This tincture tastes amazing. I have been baffled at how that's possible, maybe the glycerine base makes that big of a difference? However it happened, I actually ENJOY the taste of this, so there isn't the slightest resistance to taking it.I have a feeling this product will be on my nightstand for a long time, until I have the equipment to easily make a homemade vegetable glycerine tincture like this.

review_title: Did not get the tincture I ordered
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2021
review_body: I ordered California Poppy and Valerian. I got straight Valerian, no poppy at all. And Valerian smells so bad, like the worst dog breath ever! I will try to return it for the correct one.Update: I returned the mismarked product and reordered. I got the right one the second time. It also smells bad, but the taste is sweet and floral.  How is that even possible? I have no idea. I take 100ml before bed, rather than the recommeded 70ml.  It does seem to help me relax and get to sleep more easily.  I do not take it for pain. But it seems to help a little with anxiety if I take it as recommended (70ml) during the day. I will probably buy iy again.

review_title: Very pretty and lovely. Wild flower.
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2023
review_body: The seeds bloomed. The flowers are pretty and lovely just as you imagine what California poppy should look like. I learned that wild flowers don't like transplanting. When I tried to transplant from the ground to the pots, I didn't succeed. All failed. Next time, when I want to share California poppy with others, I will scatter the seeds on the dirt in the pot and place them on the ground. Thank you so much for the product! Also, one friend of mine from Japan was impressed by the plants when they were before blooming, and she took a trip down to southern California to see the super bloom. She and her husband enjoyed the trip. I'm glad I had this opportunity this year so they could have a great vacation.

name: Hawaii Pharm California Poppy Alcohol-Free Liquid Extract, Organic California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) Dried above-Ground Part Glycerite Natural Herbal Supplement 4 oz
description: California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) is a typical species of herbaceous plants of the genus Eschscholzia. The stem is straight or branched, smooth, sometimes bluish in color. The root is rod, powerful. A flower is solitary with yellow to orange petals. California Poppy blooms from February to September. The flower closes at night and in cold windy weather, and opens again in the morning, but may remain closed if it is cloudy weather.
features: California Poppy Alcohol-FREE liquid extract contains ONLY natural ingredients! | High Quality California Poppy Alcohol-FREE liquid extract - we use classic conventional methods of extraction! Really the BEST California Poppy herbal glycerite on market!

description: Metagenics Tran-Q Sleep supports individuals who are seeking a natural approach to improving their sleep quality and managing occasional stress. This herbal supplement is a blend of botanicals that supports the body's natural processes to foster relaxation and tranquility at bedtime.* The formulation includes 726 mg of passionflower extract, a well-known botanical that has traditionally been used to calm nerves and support relaxation.* In combination with 554 mg of jujube seed extract, this supplement provides a foundation for a calm evening routine. Tran-Q Sleep also features 250 mg of California poppy extract and 80 mg of English lavender flowering tops oil, both of which are highly regarded for their roles in supporting relaxation for a restful night's sleep.* The careful selection of these herbal ingredients results in a melatonin-free, drug-free, and hormone-free supplement, offering a pure option for adults seeking calm supplements. Take 1-2 tablets daily with evening meal or as directed by your healthcare practitioner. features: Sleep Support: Tran-Q Sleep combines the properties of passion flower with jujube seed to provide relief for occasional stress and sleeplessness* | 250 mg California Poppy Extract: Known for its calming effects, 250 mg California poppy and 80 mg lavender oil support relaxation and calmness* | Passion Flower: 726 mg passionflower and 554 mg jujube seed extract help calm nerves during bedtime to help you fall asleep* | 100% Melatonin-Free: Our supplement is a non-GMO, gluten-free, and vegetarian formula, and contains no melatonin, drugs, or hormones | Designed by Nature, Trusted by Doctors: At Metagenics, we connect people with products that help them live healthier, happier lives
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2024
review_body: Here are the facts that I do know. The item comes in a dark glass bottle, which is an ideal packaging for this supplement. It is a bit rare to find supplements in a glass bottle, and having them in dark glass will prevent or at least slow down Depreciation. I also do love the main ingredients in this supplement. There is a list of other ingredients and there are several of them I’m not a fan of including maltodextrin. So be aware of that. As for how these are working, it is a bit hard to tell.  There are many other variables that affect sleep. Clearly, this is not a supplement that will knock your socks off, but I’m not looking for that either. Will continue to take and time will tell.

review_title: LOVE THESE- FINALLY, A Sleep Aid With Lavender Again
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 12, 2024
review_body: I had a sleep aid I loved which had lavender essential oil in half the capsule and powder herbs in the other.  It was diluted, of course.  It worked better than anything else I used at the time.  Then they seemed to have stopped making it.  I have missed that.  This, however, is a close second!HOW THIS COMESThis comes in a bottle which is glass, not plastic.  I am partial to those.CAPSULESThese are pressed pills with a dividing line down the center if you want to cut them in half.  They break easily.CONTENTSI love what is in these, but did want to point out that sometimes certain herbs will register positive on drug tests.  I know of some people who ate poppy seed cookies or cakes that had false positives, so check on that prior to using these if that is a concern to you.  Otherwise the ingredients in this are pretty nice.SMELL/FLAVORThis has lavender in it.  I do occasionally burp up lavender after taking with a meal.  I love it so it does not bother me.  It might bother some people.DIGESTIONI had no issues with digestion other than occasional burps with lavender usually only once and that is it.DO THEY WORK?I must say these do seem to work well to not only help me sleep , but help me go back to sleep even after having to go to the bathroom at night.GROGGY?I don't feel groggy when I wake up, but I do feel rested.THE BOTTOM LINEI like these a lot.  I will definitely consider a repurchase.MY RATINGFIVE STARS.  These are my new favorite sleep aid for natural sleep assistance.  I am really happy to have found a lavender based supplement again as it does seem to help a lot.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 17, 2024
review_body: These don’t seem to work for me, true everyone’s system is different but my sleep was no better then when I didn’t take anything. I do know that with herbs the quality is what matters and depends on where they are grown, how they are grown and lastly how they are processed. The herbs themselves are generally good but as I said where, How grown and processed determines if the product is high quality or low quality. I’m an herbalist so I anyalize things quite thoroughly. I saw no improvement by trying this product.

review_title: A somewhat effective sleep aid, but the taste is absolutely horrible
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2024
review_body: I am someone who has always had trouble falling and staying asleep and I’ve tried countless products over the years.Something as basic as melatonin never really worked well for me, and I don’t like highly addictive medication‘s either, so I always look for a happy medium.When I came across this product, it had such a great list of high-quality ingredients and when I looked its contents up online, they seemed promising.I went ahead and placed an order for them and they arrived pretty quickly.They come in really heavy duty glass jar which almost shattered on the floor because I wasn’t expecting it to be so heavy when I slid it out of the box.As far as the pills themselves, they are a bit large in size.Normally, I would suggest breaking them in half, but the taste is so horrible to begin with that when you break them in half it’s even worse.They are very abrasive, and taking them with a lot of water, it’s still hard to avoid the harness of the flavor, at least for me.Some people may not have as big of an issue with it as I do, but for me, it’s just overbearing.I haven’t really noticed that much of a difference in my sleep pattern either.I don’t fall asleep any faster, but I seem to sleep a little more solid during the night so I maybe can chalk that up to these.But, for the little bit of difference and sleep, it’s not really worth the horrible flavor plus the high price tag.I do feel that for this price point There are much better supplements out there that will help you get a good nights sleep.I hope my review helps you to make a more well informed decision.

review_title: Really hard to guage if it's working
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2024
review_body: This glass bottle contains one month of supplements. The bottle says it's tested by a third party, but there's very little information about the product on the packaging itself. Instead, there's a QR code to give you that information. These do not contain any melatonin and use products including lavender and poppy seed to help lull you to sleep. It's important to note that none of these products' effectiveness has been studied or backed up by the FDA.On that note, I replaced my regular melatonin and sleep aid combo to see if I was able to get quality sleep. Unfortunately, after trying for a week, I went back to my old standby. The taste of the lavender was too much for me, but I thought it was worth it if I got better sleep. Unfortunately, this was not the case. I've since given these to my husband to try, but he rarely has sleep issues so these may expire before he gets the chance to use them.They might work for some, but they didn't do much for me (that I could tell, anyway).

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 11, 2024
review_body: I don’t have a lab to analyze these chemically, but anecdotally they seem to work. I work 3rd shift and some mornings I just couldn’t get to sleep despite blackout curtains and several years of this schedule. Now when I get home I take one (haven’t tried two) of these and get in bed. No issues dozing off and no weird dreams like some sleep aids give. Even if it’s a placebo effect, if it works it works.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 16, 2024
review_body: I ordered these in April 2024, and they came in a double-safety-sealed brown glass bottle with an expiration date of November 2025. I have taken them for about a week, and they do seem to relax me after about two hours.The smell/taste of lavender, which I use quite a bit of, is borderline overpowering. I don't mind it but it is very strong and other people might not have as much tolerance. The capsules are large, and some people may have difficulty swallowing them. The listing says these are 3rd-party tested, and that testing information is available for each batch; although it's not listed, I assume that is what the QR code is for.While they work for me, I feel the price point is very high. However, it's clearly a quality product.As always, you should consult your doctor before taking any supplement.

Tran-Q Sleep also features 250 mg of California poppy extract and 80 mg of English lavender flowering tops oil, both of which are highly regarded for their roles in supporting relaxation for a restful night's sleep.* The careful selection of these herbal ingredients results in a melatonin-free, drug-free, and hormone-free supplement, offering a pure option for adults seeking calm supplements. Take 1-2 tablets daily with evening meal or as directed by your healthcare practitioner. With a heritage of breakthrough science, innovative products, unsurpassed quality, practitioner education, and dedicated partnerships, it is clear why Metagenics has become one of the most trusted health and wellness brands worldwide. For over 40 years Metagenics has developed high-quality, science-based nutritional supplements, medical foods, and lifestyle programs to support the growing number of people seeking to improve their health and achieve their wellness goals.
features: Sleep Support: Tran-Q Sleep combines the properties of passion flower with jujube seed to provide relief for occasional stress and sleeplessness* | 250 mg California Poppy Extract: Known for its calming effects, 250 mg California poppy and 80 mg lavender oil support relaxation and calmness* | Passion Flower: 726 mg passionflower and 554 mg jujube seed extract help calm nerves during bedtime to help you fall asleep* | 100% Melatonin-Free: Our supplement is a non-GMO, gluten-free, and vegetarian formula, and contains no melatonin, drugs, or hormones | Designed by Nature, Trusted by Doctors: At Metagenics, we connect people with products that help them live healthier, happier lives
review_title: High quality, calming properties but you have to be ok with heavy lavender smell & taste
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2024
review_body: Metagenics is a supplement brand I trust for quality. I’ve purchased them thru medical practitioner initially, so I this melatonin-free formula intrigued me. Admittedly, falling asleep has never been my strong suit. And melatonin makes me feel terrible. I tried it for 2 nights. I started with one tablet. The challenge for me is that it really tastes like Lavender-it’s overpowering. The first night I took after my evening meal & tasted the lavender the rest of the night. I can say it seemed to having a calming effect. The 2nd night I took in the middle of my meal and the taste lingered less so. Again, felt calming effect without a groggy morning feeling. The fragrance from the bottle is so strong that I had to remove it from my kitchen where I store my supplement as it’s like having a lavender sachet in a drawer. So while I think I liked the calming effects of the formula, sadly I’m unable to continue taking, because the lavender is too disruptive. It’s really unfortunate- hope they consider reformulating with less lavender or no lavender as the other ingredient are compelling.

review_title: A good brand, but there are a few qualms…
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2024
review_body: I was excited to see a Metagenics product to try as this is a very high quality brand. It has a good blend of ingredients, but way too many additives/excipients in my opinion. I’m also not a fan of the lavender as the taste is way too strong and it can affect estrogen levels.As an herbalist, I really appreciate the California poppy (mildly pain relieving in addition to sedating), passionflower (great for calming a racing mind and soothing the body), and jujube (which has similar properties to the passionflower).If this didn’t have the lavender and had cleaner/less excipients, this would be something I would enjoy taking more regularly. I also noticed I had to take extra on one particular night where I was struggling to sleep, but it did eventually help.

description: California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) is a typical species of herbaceous plants of the genus Eschscholzia. The stem is straight or branched, smooth, sometimes bluish in color. The root is rod, powerful. A flower is with yellow to orange petals. California Poppy blooms from February to September. The flower closes at night and in cold windy weather, and opens again in the morning, but may remain closed if it is cloudy weather. Kava Kava (Piper Methysticum) is an upright, dioecious, evergreen shrub that grows to 10-15’ tall with glossy dark green leaves. It grows on a number of South Pacific islands (Micronesia, Fiji, Hawaii, New Guinea, the Samoas, Tonga and Vanuatu), but the specific place of origin is unknown. Male plants produce short spikes of small creamy white flowers, but female plants rarely flower.

review_title: For a Deeper More Relaxing Sleep
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 17, 2024
review_body: On occasion I need a little something to put me in the mood for sleeping at night. I find that Hit the Hay is a product that helps me to get the quality sleep I need when those occasions arise. It is made from a soothing blend of herbs like kava kava, california poppy, and passion flower, which are designed to work harmoniously to relax my mind and muscles to help me achieve a calm state primed for deep, restorative sleep.  Happily, I find that the formula does work for me.  The serving size of just one teaspoon does the trick for me most nights.  If not, I take a second dose about an hour later.  With 12 servings per bottle, I find I have a sufficient supply to last a while.  I like this supplement, because it works, it is plant-based, sustainable, and non habit-forming.  Plus, it does not leave me with a hangover the next day.  I note for everyone that it does not contain Melatonin.

review_title: Works, but need a glass of water for a chaser.
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2024
review_body: I've been battling some occasional sleep problems lately, so I decided to give Urban Moonshine a try. It comes in a small 2 fl oz bottle with a dropper, which is nice for measuring doses. This stuff packs a punch! The dose is only 1 teaspoon, but it has a strong taste. I definitely recommend having a glass of water on hand to chase it down. Hit The Hay does seem to work. It helps me unwind and relax before bed, and on nights I use it, I fall asleep faster and stay asleep longer. It definitely takes the edge off and helps me quiet my mind. It's important to note that the bottle says it's for short-term use only, so I'm not sure if I'd take it every night.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 28, 2024
review_body: I am a sucker for products that truly promote sleep support and relaxation. Unfortunately this product missed the mark. First red flag was the proprietary blend. For those who do not know, manufacturers use "proprietary blends" as a way of preventing someone else from reformulating their product by showing the ingredients but hiding the amounts of each. This is bad news in the supplement world for a couple of reasons: 1) you don't know how much of each ingredient you are getting, so there is no telling if you are getting a very underdosed or overdosed amount of any particular ingredient, and 2) because you do not know how much you are getting of each ingredient, you don't know if you are getting ripped off or not. This product is quite expensive at $36 before tax. You can deduce that the combined total of all these ingredients in the proprietary blend are less than half thanks to the disclosure of 48-53% alcohol which leads me to the next red flag.To help with this perspective, this product is "96-106 proof." Sure, the serving size is quite low, but alcohol is known to be neurotoxic and deleterious to sleep. Definitely not something I want to see in a sleep/relaxation product. But at least you might be able to take comfort in that this won't likely be abused for its alcohol content as the taste is unbearable.I really can get past things that are not the best taste if it means I am getting something of great benefit to my health. However, you almost cannot use this product after you try it for the first time because of how of putting the taste is.I wish I had one thing good to say, but they made it really hard. The branding of this product is enticing and creative maybe.But overall I think you are better of looking for something else at this price point. Something that tells you exactly what you are getting in your product.

review_title: Urban Moonshine Hit the Hay Sleep Support
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2024
review_body: Expiration date is stamped on the bottle, showing 08/2026.  This arrived to me 03/2024, so there's plenty of time here.Suggested serving shows as five droppers full, which works out to 12 doses per bottle.  That's  $2.75 per dose at the current price of $32.99.  Moreover, dosage recommendations call for a second round one hour after the first one "if needed", effectively doubling the price per dose.  Keep this in mind.This product is NOT marked with the location of manufacture, only that it's "Manufactured for" a company in Vermont.  The address listed seems to be a "co-working" facility, so that's obviously not where it's made at.  I'm docking a star for lack of transparency.The bottle has a plastic shrinkwrap over bottledropper/lid.  Given the nature of the product, that's about all you can expect.  Not an anti-tamper measure, but the package came with a good bubble overwrap to protect the product and to help avoid spillage.Product is marked as for "short term use only".  Probably just as well given the price tag per day.

Add Urban Moonshine cult-favorite Stress & Mood formulas to your daily routine to buoy your emotional and mental well-being. | Ingredients: Alcohol Cane Ethanol, Passionflower Aerials Parts, California Poppy Aerial Parts, Kava Root, Hops, Honey | SUPPORT SMALL BUSINESS: Urban Moonshine is proudly Certified Organic, Woman-Owned and Independent | SUGGESTED USE: 5 ml (1 tsp). Can repeat a second time one hour later if necessary. One bottle contains approximately 12 servings. For occassional use.*
review_title: I felt its effects but I had a hard time swallowing it
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2024
review_body: So I sometimes have issues falling asleep because of a racing mind and wanted to try a more natural approach. The first thing it tastes awful. It brought back college memories of Jagermiester.  I could only handle one dropper when the recommended dose was 5 droppers. Soon after, I felt myself relax and slow down my mind enough to close my eyes and drift off. It works well but at a price. One I'm willing to pay when I'm desperate enough for sleep.

review_title: Kinda works for me.. Like a shot of moonshine.
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2024
review_body: Urban Moonshine Hit The Hay - Fast Acting Sleep Support* with California Poppy & Kava - Supports Relaxation* - Intended for Short-Term Use - Gluten Free Herbal Supplement - 2 Fl Oz.Well, I have tried this for times when trying to fall asleep and I cannot get my brain to flip the "off" switch.. I think it does have some drowsy effect. Not as much (for me) as Melatonin..The suggested dose is five droppers-full.  I will warn you: This stuff is 50% alcohol.  You WILL feel it.  A nice warm burn all the way down. The 2 oz. bottle contains about 12 doses.Be Warned: it is for short term use.  I think because Kava has some risks when used for long term.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 29, 2024
review_body: Each of the featured ingredients of this supplement are important for good health - from joints, to circulation and to kidneys. I've really just started taking it. So still have to see how I benefit - or not (hence the 4 stars not 5 yet). And since I am not a large person, I am taking only one capsule though to get the full label dosage 4 are recommended. The capsules are relatively large. So it's easy to believe they contain all the ingredients listed. Despite their size, they are very easy for me to swallow. And I have not had any negative after effects - neither bad taste nor stomach burn. So I will continue to take the supplement and hope to benefit from all its excellent ingredients.

brand: California Poppy Alcohol-Free Liquid Extract, Organic California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) Dried Above-Ground Part Glycerite 4 oz
name: California Poppy Alcohol-Free Liquid Extract, Organic California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) Dried Above-Ground Part Glycerite 4 oz
description: The California poppy is the state flower of California, a tender perennial plant bearing blue-green leaves and 2 to 4 inch (5 to 10 cm) wide flowers that open in bright sun and close on cloudy days and at night. The California poppy is considered an ancient plant whose origins are not entirely known. Native Americans in California prized them as a source of food and for the oil that could be extracted from the plant. Eschscholzia californica was the first named member of the genus Eschscholzia, which was named by the German botanist Adelbert von Chamisso after the Baltic German botanist Johann Friedrich von Eschscholtz, his friend and colleague on Otto von Kotzebue’s scientific expedition to California and the greater Pacific in mid-1810s aboard the Russian ship Rurik.
features: California Poppy Glycerite contains ONLY natural ingredients! Alcohol Free! Gluten Free! Non-GMO! | High Quality California Poppy NON-Alcohol liquid extract - we use classic conventional methods of extraction! We meticulously produce our extracts according to precise standards where each herb is extracted according to the distinct characteristic of each plant! | The highest quality California Poppy Glycerin based liquid extract made with love for plants and respect for Nature! | We strictly use Only Certified or ethically sourced wild harvested raw material, vegetable palm glycerin and crystal clear artesian purified water! Really the BEST California Poppy herbal glycerite on market!
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2023
review_body: Have been drinking pure kava root for years, decided to get into experimenting with tinctures; this is the strongest and most pure I’ve found yet, between online and local dealers— so much so that I rarely buy from anyone else anymore. Though, my one concern is quality of consistency. I will purchase a few more times before I come to a conclusion and comment definitely on consistency though. I say this because it would be nice to just invest in the 64oz, so long as shelf life doesn’t play a roll in keeping kava long term.

name: California Poppy and Valerian Liquid Extract, Organic California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) and Valerian (Valeriana Officinalis) Tincture Supplement 2x4 oz
description: California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) is a typical species of herbaceous plants of the genus Eschscholzia. The stem is straight or branched, smooth, sometimes bluish in color. The root is rod, powerful. A flower is solitary with yellow to orange petals. California Poppy blooms from February to September. The flower closes at night and in cold windy weather, and opens again in the morning, but may remain closed if it is cloudy weather. Valerian Root also known as Valeriana officinalis. Common Valerian, European Valerian, Valeriana and Allheal. Valerian is a perennial plant, native to Europe and parts of Asia. It grows in meadows and woodlands within moist, temperate climates and has since been naturalized in North America. The root system consists of a vertical rhizome and an abundance of smaller rootlets which are harvested and dried at temperatures less than 105 degrees Fahrenheit.

Really the BEST California Poppy and Valerian root extract on market!

description: California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) is a typical species of herbaceous plants of the genus Eschscholzia. The stem is straight or branched, smooth, sometimes bluish in color. The root is rod, powerful. A flower is solitary with yellow to orange petals. California Poppy blooms from February to September. The flower closes at night and in cold windy weather, and opens again in the morning, but may remain closed if it is cloudy weather. Saint John's Wort (Hypericum Perforatum) is a perennial herbaceous plant up to 30 - 100 cm high. The stalk is dihedral bare in the upper part is oppositely branched. Rhizomes and roots are underdeveloped, unbranched. The leaves are oval or ovoid, with translucent glands in the form of black dots. Petals are strewn with black-brown or purple dots, especially around the edge. The plant blooms in June-August. The fruit is a three-celled oblong-ovate capsule. Seeds are small, cylindrical, brown. The fruits ripen in September-October.

brand: Healthy Gut BeSerene IR | GABA & L-Theanine | 1.9 OZ
name: Healthy Gut BeSerene IR | GABA & L-Theanine | 1.9 OZ
features: BeSerene Instant Relief Cream is a natural supplement that helps you feel calm and is there for you when your thoughts won't stop and your emotions spike- day or night. | Our advanced delivery system is designed to work fast, providing relief in 10 minutes or less. | BeSerene Instant Relief Cream is made with special ingredients like GABA, Mulungu, Albizia Supreme, California Poppy, and L-Theanine, which are all known for their calming effects on the body and mind. | You can apply the cream to your wrists or temples, and it will absorb into your skin to help you feel more at ease. | Works best when used in conjunction with BeSerene Daily for a holistic calming system.
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2024
review_body: I originally bought this for my husband, who responds best to beer as a catalyst for sleep. He has always worked the late shift since he was 15 and recently got an early morning job, so his body isn't adjusting too well. Figuring that it was either the hops or the GABA in the beer that was making him drowsy, I tried making him some herbal tea blends with hops since I had some on-hand. It didn't do anything. So of course, to Amazon!I wasn't searching for a topical product but it aligned with his mentality that pills are bad, so I took a chance on it. Wowow this product W O R K S. Not just for my husband, but for me! I don't have trouble falling asleep, but I don't get good, deep sleep once I'm in that state. This cream fixes that issue completely! I feel so incredibly rested - provided I give myself time for 8 hours.I was sold on one reciew that mentioned they don't even remember falling asleep, and I must say that is exactly my experience as well! I started with 1 pump on my wrists and enjoyed the results, but the best rest comes from applying it to my temples! And I don't need very much when I apply it there compared to my wrists, so it's cost-saving too!If you are unsure on this one, I say take a chance. The worst that can happen is you lose some money, but I think that's better than losing sleep!!

review_body: I'm having a hard time getting over the price of $35 for this small pump bottle.I haven't felt much difference, to be honest.I take it and then wait for something and generally nothing different is felt.It could be subtle, I admit.But should you feel something more dramatic at $35 for less than 2 ounces?You don't eat it, you rub it on your skin.That sounded promising. I mean, our skin is our largest organ, right?I tried hard to let it work but nothing transpired.Maybe I got a dud bottle or something. I dunno.But I felt nothing.

brand: Healthy Gut BeSerene IR | GABA & L-Theanine | 1.9 OZ
name: Healthy Gut BeSerene IR | GABA & L-Theanine | 1.9 OZ
features: BeSerene Instant Relief Cream is a natural supplement that helps you feel calm and is there for you when your thoughts won't stop and your emotions spike- day or night. | Our advanced delivery system is designed to work fast, providing relief in 10 minutes or less. | BeSerene Instant Relief Cream is made with special ingredients like GABA, Mulungu, Albizia Supreme, California Poppy, and L-Theanine, which are all known for their calming effects on the body and mind. | You can apply the cream to your wrists or temples, and it will absorb into your skin to help you feel more at ease. | Works best when used in conjunction with BeSerene Daily for a holistic calming system.
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 10, 2024
review_body: This is a review for Healthy Gut Be Serene.I ordered this out of curiosity. I didn't believe that a cream could help you destress and relax or even help you get back to sleep. I was almost afraid to try it just in case it was true! So I did the safest thing possible, I used half the dosage before bedtime. As I sat in bed reading for a few minutes as I always do I was overcome by a feeling of "end of the day" relief. I never finished reading that page. In the morning, I found my book on the floor. I never have sleep problems but that night I had barely been in bed a few minutes before my lights went out and that was on half a dose. At the next opportunity I got brave and used a half dose in the middle of the day. It felt like i had a midday pause for a cup of tea! It did not make me sleepy but I did feel renewed and less stressed to continue the rest of the day.  From that point I experimented with dosing depending on how stressed I was feeling.I like the idea of a topical cream. I can keep it in my purse and not worry it's going to spill like liquid drops. HealthyGut products are non GMO, they have no fillers and they use a cGMP facility. However, I don't see information about 3rd party lab testing. In my opinion that is probably the most important certification. you can have. Lastly, unfortunately these supplements from Healthy Gut are very overpriced especially lacking some important certifications.  That really limits the customer base who will no doubt go elsewhere until they find an answer as the founders did in their 'story'. I am not so sure I will order this again but I can definitely recommend this "Be Serene Cream"

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 16, 2024
review_body: If you have trouble taking melatonin as I do this product seems to relax your mind and body allowing you to fall asleep and stay asleep for hours.GABA is known to help with sleep as is l-theanine and this easy to apply cream has both plus California poppy and other ingredients meant to calm a racing mind. It is very lightly scented and I have had no negative effects from the cream ingredients (there is a lengthy list of ingredients). I apply it about an hour before I want to fall asleep although the instructions suggest ten minutes.I wish it wasn’t as expensive as it is but, in the end, you pay for what you get. This cream calms your mind allowing you to fall asleep and restore your senses without using melatonin. It would be a great aid for those who have daytime anxiety because it is so easy to use.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2024
review_body: So it definitely does something. I am giving it three stars for that. I was having a stressed out moment this morning from family where I literally felt like that Scream face painting, and I decided to try a pump's worth on my inner arm. The cream is an opaque brown color like a coffee with creamer. It is not oily and seems to absorb quickly without irritation, though stings very, very slightly (I am guessing from alcohol content in it and I have baby sensitive skin; on regular skin it is probably not noticeable). I appreciate there is no added fragrance or perfumes. I did experience palpitations about 15 minutes after I put it on, and I never usually get those. It may be that I should have used less than a full pump as I am a petite woman at 125 lbs. Be careful if you are sensitive, and test first with a small dot, to ensure it is suitable for you.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2024
review_body: I love the choice of ingredients and the fact that it’s certified organic too. It’s fairly easy to take (2 dropperfuls once to three times a day) but it’s hard for me to get a “full” dropper.  It fills up about 3/4 of the way no matter how I angle the bottle and position the dropper.  And there’s no line or indicator to show how full it needs to be.  However, since they say you can take it up to 3x a day I guess you don’t have to be too cautious about overdosing.  The taste is also a little strong for me personally — the thyme really is prominent in this.  I am used to herbal supplements and normally don’t have any issues with weird concoctions but with this one I’d have to get used to it.  I was able to do one dropper of it without mixing into anything but I think I’ll try hiding it in a tart juice, but it’s such a strange combination of flavors I’m not sure I could stand drinking it in a full cup of juice.  In a pinch I would use this but I think I’d prefer a pill or just a simple elderberry gummy instead.  Just my preference anyway.  Otherwise the product itself is clean and seems to be an excellent way to boost your immune system when necessary.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2024
review_body: This item is a 30ml amber bottle of organic herb tincture that is plant based and formulated to provide immunity support. The bottle includes an eye dropper cap that is used to deliver the recommended 2 dropper full of the liquid. The ingredients includes extracts of echinacea, elderberry, thyme, sage, yarrow, and lemon balm in a proprietary combination. The claim is that this tincture will support a healthy immune system and provide a defense against seasonal threats that can make you ill, per the product description. I'm familiar with all the ingredients, but feel that there are minerals and vitamins that should be added to the mix to boost immunity. The liquid tastes quite bad so I recommend adding the 2 dropper full to some juice. I appreciate that it's made in the USA. I find the price point for 20 days supply to be rather steep. Overall, it's not a bad tincture to add to your daily supplement regiment, but it's not something I will continue to use given I have other more cost effective immunity support supplements.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2024
review_body: Not entirely sure how great of a benefit one gets from the Qat listed here instead of the actual qat used in places like Yemen, but this stuff does not have any acute effects that you will notice immediately. Most importantly, if you're very sensitive to taste, this is definitely one of those "acquired tastes" products, but I generally liked it and thought it was pleasant enough after the initial use. Might have benefits over time, but hard to tell.

brand: Apothékary Wine Down Herbal Supplement, Alcohol-Free Red Wine-Inspired Tincture, Sugar Free, Gluten Free, Vegan- 100 Servings- 4.07oz
name: Apothékary Wine Down Herbal Supplement, Alcohol-Free Red Wine-Inspired Tincture, Sugar Free, Gluten Free, Vegan- 100 Servings- 4.07oz
description: CLINICAL HERBALIST-CRAFTED FORMULA FOR STRESS, IMMUNITY, AND SLEEP*: Made with potent herbs used for centuries and proven by science to help calm feelings of stress and tension, support the immune system, and soothe you to sleep.
features: ALL NATURAL & ORGANIC INGREDIENTS: Featuring powerful herbs like California poppy, blue vervain, and tart cherry. | Combined with elderberry and hawthorn berry which provide antioxidants that support the body’s natural immune response. | HOW TO: Drop ½ to 1 full-dropper under the tongue for faster tension support or add to a glass of sparkling water, juice, or mocktail for hours of rest and relaxation. | 100 SERVINGS: One full dropper each day for over three months to support the body’s immune system | THIRD-PARTY TESTED: Wine Down is third-party tested for quality and efficacy.
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2024
review_body: i’m glad i got this “wine down” relaxation supplement, but i can’t tell if it has much of an effect on me for promoting sleep.  it arrived safely sealed, and the expiry date on the bottle is a year and a half away.  i like that it comes in a glass bottle with a dropper, and the ingredients seem good.  i’ve taken it a few times and had no bad reaction.  the taste is really mild when i mix it with water.  when i put it directly on or under my tongue, i find the taste pleasant, slightly sweet and herbal, with no aftertaste.  this is currently listed for $89 for 4oz, which makes it rather pricey.  there are many lower-cost similarly effective supplements available that i would buy rather than this, but if this is within your budget, i would suggest trying out their smaller bottle.

brand: Apothékary Wine Down Herbal Supplement, Alcohol-Free Red Wine-Inspired Tincture, Sugar Free, Gluten Free, Vegan- 100 Servings- 4.07oz
name: Apothékary Wine Down Herbal Supplement, Alcohol-Free Red Wine-Inspired Tincture, Sugar Free, Gluten Free, Vegan- 100 Servings- 4.07oz
description: CLINICAL HERBALIST-CRAFTED FORMULA FOR STRESS, IMMUNITY, AND SLEEP*: Made with potent herbs used for centuries and proven by science to help calm feelings of stress and tension, support the immune system, and soothe you to sleep.
features: ALL NATURAL & ORGANIC INGREDIENTS: Featuring powerful herbs like California poppy, blue vervain, and tart cherry. | Combined with elderberry and hawthorn berry which provide antioxidants that support the body’s natural immune response. | HOW TO: Drop ½ to 1 full-dropper under the tongue for faster tension support or add to a glass of sparkling water, juice, or mocktail for hours of rest and relaxation. | 100 SERVINGS: One full dropper each day for over three months to support the body’s immune system | THIRD-PARTY TESTED: Wine Down is third-party tested for quality and efficacy.
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2024
review_body: The Apothekary Wine Down is an herbal liquid tincture supplement that is inspired by red wine. It has a bold, flavorful taste and is made with high-quality organic ingredients such as poppy from California, blue vervain, tart cherry, elderberry, and hawthorn. It has a bold flavor that is described as sweet and fruity, with a mild cinnamon undertone. The supplement comes in a 4.07oz bottle and has 100 servings.Overall, the Apothekary Wine Down is a natural supplement that can help individuals unwind and prepare for a restful night's sleep. Its unique blend of herbal extracts and lack of common allergens make it an attractive option for those looking for a safe and effective way to relax and improve sleep quality.I have to admit that when I first heard about Apothekary Wine Down, I was a bit skeptical about its claims of being "wine replacement" and promoting relaxation and improving sleep quality. I've tried other supplements in the past that promised similar benefits, but ultimately fell short of delivering on their promises. However, after giving Wine Down a try for several nights in a row, I was pleasantly surprised by how well it worked. I like the flavor and easy-to-take formula made it a breeze to incorporate into my bedtime routine, and I found myself feeling more relaxed and calm than usual. I noticed that I was sleeping better and waking up feeling more refreshed, which was a great bonus. While I still approach supplements with a healthy dose of skepticism, I have to say that Apothekary Wine Down has won me over - it's definitely a product that I would recommend to others looking for a natural way to unwind and improve their sleep. My only "complaint" is a steep price. But if you break it down per dose, it's definitely cheaper than wine :)

brand: Apothékary Wine Down Herbal Supplement, Alcohol-Free Red Wine-Inspired Tincture, Sugar Free, Gluten Free, Vegan- 100 Servings- 4.07oz
name: Apothékary Wine Down Herbal Supplement, Alcohol-Free Red Wine-Inspired Tincture, Sugar Free, Gluten Free, Vegan- 100 Servings- 4.07oz
description: CLINICAL HERBALIST-CRAFTED FORMULA FOR STRESS, IMMUNITY, AND SLEEP*: Made with potent herbs used for centuries and proven by science to help calm feelings of stress and tension, support the immune system, and soothe you to sleep.
features: ALL NATURAL & ORGANIC INGREDIENTS: Featuring powerful herbs like California poppy, blue vervain, and tart cherry. | Combined with elderberry and hawthorn berry which provide antioxidants that support the body’s natural immune response. | HOW TO: Drop ½ to 1 full-dropper under the tongue for faster tension support or add to a glass of sparkling water, juice, or mocktail for hours of rest and relaxation. | 100 SERVINGS: One full dropper each day for over three months to support the body’s immune system | THIRD-PARTY TESTED: Wine Down is third-party tested for quality and efficacy.
review_title: Not sure how effective this is
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2024
review_body: I am someone who drinks wine, and sometimes likes to WINE DOWN with wine, and who is also in an area where weed is legal and sometimes like to WEED DOWN to sleep.  This has a high bar to clear.  First the packaging.  This is a well packaged product with a sturdy and secure box and a very strong container for the actual liquid.  The dropper is also nice and easy to use.  The liquid itself has a very sweet taste with an herbal tinge, which makes sense given the ingredient list.I used this a couple of times, always opting for the first delivery method: placing a droppers worth of liquid under/on my tongue for 10 seconds.In all cases I was able to sleep, and I would even categorize my sleep as "fine" or "restful" but I do not know how much this expensive tincture contributed to it.  I can say that one thing I did notice is that my dreams were much weirder when I took this.Be careful with this I guess, its very pricey.

However, after giving Wine Down a try for several nights in a row, I noticed it did provide a subtle relaxation effect. It by no means gives that "buzz" you get from wine, but in my opinion the relaxation effect is much better and my sleep deeper.

brand: Apothékary Wine Down Herbal Supplement, Alcohol-Free Red Wine-Inspired Tincture, Sugar Free, Gluten Free, Vegan- 100 Servings- 4.07oz

review_title: no noticeable difference after using this supplement
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2024
review_body: My husband and I have both tried this wine down herbal supplement.  He put a full dropper under his tongue as recommended and hated the taste.  He said it tastes similar to cough syrup.  I preferred to try it mixed with sparkling water.  My sparkling water is already slightly flavored, so even with 2 full droppers mixed with 12 ounces of water, I didn't really notice a taste difference.  It was good to me, but again it was mostly sparkling water which I enjoy.  I have to say neither one of us really noticed anything different.  We both took this supplement at night, when we were probably already a bit tired and relaxed, so I cannot tell if it had any kind of noticeable effect.  For that reason, I can't really recommend this due to the high cost.  Maybe it works on some, but I would have to be very sure before spending a lot of money.

brand: Apothékary Wine Down Herbal Supplement, Alcohol-Free Red Wine-Inspired Tincture, Sugar Free, Gluten Free, Vegan- 100 Servings- 4.07oz

review_title: I love Wine Down to wind down ;)
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2024
review_body: After taking Apothekary's Wine Down for about a week, never in my life have I thought I'd say something like this, but this tincture tastes like autumn to me (even though I began taking it in summer ;). And this tincture, when it touches my tongue, spreads a wonderful taste over it- and a quick moment later, there is a slow burn that begins and remains for a bit after.Wine Down comes in a lovely dark white colored glass bottle (not see through, white glass) with a dropper attached to the cap. Both the bottle and dropper are glass and both, the very best quality. The directions tell you to squeeze one drop on or under the tongue and let sit for ten seconds. If you don't like the taste however, you can put it in a drink. You are told in these directions you can take this tincture up to four times a day.When I took Wine Down, I felt the effects quickly- within a couple minutes, and in all honesty, it does have a very good calming effect. It worked so well I took to taking it with me during the day and taking it when I needed to relax. I wouldn't  say Wine Down is terribly intense though, it's just something that actually helped me to relax- as if before I couldn't quote catch my breath and after- well, there was no longer that problem.Wine Down is something that I will definitely be using in the future, because, for me, there were so many positive effects- not only did the tincture relax me but when I took it before bed, it also helped to get me to sleep better- during my “wind down” time (and now this is my “Wine Down” time ;).I am really in love with this product, I don't go anywhere without it (just in case I need it) and have never been so happy to have chosen this product to review on Amazon as- it would have never been something that I tried on my own!

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2024
review_body: This product was very intriguing as I am always chasing a good, restful night's sleep. This was the first product I have seen of this type. It is easy to take and had a fruit-like flavor. Slightly sweet, but not overpowering. Effect wise, I would rate this a 3.5, rounded up to 4. Value-wise, it is on the expensive side, especially because I usually wind up taking 2 doses compared to the recommended one dose. I do feel more relaxed after taking, but can't say 100% if it helps me get a deeper/more relaxing sleep. It would be nice to offer in a trial size so you could see how well it works before committing to the full size.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2024
review_body: The first time I tried it (sublingual), I sorta felt relaxed, but not like a buzz from drinking.  Don't get me wrong, after a long week, feeling relaxed is a big perk.  I waited a few days before trying it again and had zero affect.  Was on an empty stomach, but figured maybe it should be a once a week treat. Waited a week and tried it again, nothing.  Waited another week and took 1.5 of the droppers to see if I simply needed more, still nothing.  This led me to believe that I either had a placebo affect or ingredients just don't affect me.  Either way, I was disappointed because I was hoping for an addition to add to my rotation of some other products I use.  For the price, I could order 2 of my other supplements that work.
