Expertly formulated with California Poppy, Ziziphus, Lemon Balm, Passionflower, Chamomile, Lavender and Cardamom—the spray is designed to be easy-to-use and rapidly absorbed. Crafted with taste in mind, it has sweet and pleasantly floral flavors. Herb Pharm never uses synthetic solvents. The company's farm is Certified Organic, Bee Friendly, and Salmon Safe. Herb Pharm is the #1 selling liquid herbal extract brand in US Natural Food (SPINS). Herb Pharm is a company of herbalists, scientists, and farmers in GMO-free Josephine County, OR. There, they have been cultivating herbs with care, precision, and respect for nature since 1979.
features: Promotes a quiet, calm and restful sleep, and provides soothing support for the nervous system. | Intuitive format makes it easier to include herbs in your healthy everyday habits. | It's sweet and pleasantly floral flavors engage your pre-digestive senses and helps your body recognize and use herbs. | Includes sweet California Poppy glycerite prepared from whole Eschscholzia californica plants (root, leaf & flower) which are Certified Organically Grown on Herb Pharm's own farm. The plants are hand-harvested while in full flower, then milled at the last moment before extraction. | This statement has not been evaluated by the FDA. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease.
review_title: Helps me fall asleep when I can't go to sleep
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2020
review_body: Herb Pharm has another winner! I rated this five stars for the formula as opposed to the delivery mechanism. I take the sprayer out and use a dropper to add it to water. The suggested use is to keep it by your bed and spray without getting up. I prefer to mix it with a little water as the spray was a bit intense for my tongue. Otherwise, the formula is great! Most sleep herbs are bitter and unpleasant. This is the best I've used so far and the flavor is decent. When I'm tossing and turning and can't get to sleep or get back to sleep, this helps do the trick. Thanks, Herb Pharm! I'm happy to be supporting a "local" company here in Oregon.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2020
review_body: Desperately wanted this to work. I have lifelong insomnia and have a closet larger than a pharmacy filled with sleep remedies from homeopathic, herbal, Chinese medicine, sprays, essential oils, and at least 15 other types of natural remedies to help me sleep. You name it -- it is in my closet.  I can get to sleep pretty well most nights without any help, but I wake up at 3:00 a.m. and then am up for the rest of the night. Doesn't matter if I hit the sack at 9:00 p.m. or 1:00 a.m.  I am up at 3:00 a.m. for the day. This was approximately my 20th try at a natural remedy for insomnia and it did not work for me. I am writing this after using it for 30 days -- every night as directed. The taste is OK for me since I am used to Chinese herbs which are horrible to taste. But this did not work -- I was up at 3:15 a.m. every night -- so maybe it gave me an extra 15 minutes before I was wide awake for the day.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2023
review_body: These really do work for me. I was so tired earlier. Took one and still tried to lay down to take a nap but never could get to sleep. Finally gave up on my nap. 4 hours later I still feel energy. Two would probably be too much for me but idk because this is day one and I’m not taking two until taking one stops working. The reviewer’s on here saying they feel nothing from these must have an extremely high tolerance to some sort of speed. Because these absolutely work for me without making me jittery like most all caffeine pills I try like stackers. Great product for energy and just what I needed. I took one after I ate just in case it messed with my stomach. So far, with food, it hasn’t bothered my stomach.

review_body: So I needed something through out the day to give me a little more of a burst of energy. I do not drink coffee as I dont care for taste but I do drink bang energy drinks or monsters. I felt these pills do give you tons of energy. I am used to energy drinks though so I felt I needed to take 2 of these. Just be careful if you aren't used to a lot of caffeine. My friend took these and she after one pill felt it was too much. I'd take half a pill to start if you're not used to it. But amazing product most likely will order again!!

review_title: The ONLY item that helps my narcolepsy
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2022
review_body: I buy this every month now, it works better than my prescribed Narcolepsy meds, ,I've been on quite a fw, including ritalin. While the ritaalin worked for about a week, now on month 2 it does nothing anymore, but I supplement with 1 or 2 of these, depending on how tired I am that day, and it works great. even with all my other meds, I needed this too. I could probably use just this, but it's a bit expensive since insurance doesn't cover it and I take it 4x/day every day. It's been 3 months and still works as well as the first day.So better, for me, than ritalin, sunosi, modafinil, a few others and better than drinking Sugar free Monster all day.  NOTHING has worked as well as these.WARNING:  IF YOU'RE NOT USED TO STIMULANTS, TAKE CAREFULLY, START WITH ONE.  You may feel a warm flush in your face and your entire body may get warm when this starts to work, but it goes away soon.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2022
review_body: These energy pills get the job done but keep in mind they are VERY STRONG. The first day I took one, it was too much. I basically felt like a tweaker which is to say I did not feel good. However, you DO get used to them & by the 2nd day I tried again & they kept me going for the last few months when I was working 55-60hr weeks. Working that many hours, as anyone who has done so will attest can really mess with your body. You start to feel like you are being dragged down slowly no matter how much sleep you get. Now that things have slowed down, I am no longer using these but they will remain in my medicine cabinet just in case the day comes when I need an extra boost!

brand: MaryRuth Organics, Herbal Supplement Drop, Calmness & Relaxation, Pack of 1, USDA Kava Root, Sugar/Gluten Free, Support Sleep, Calm & Stress Relief, Vegan, Non-GMO, 30 Servings
name: MaryRuth Organics, Herbal Supplement Drop, Calmness & Relaxation, Pack of 1, USDA Kava Root, Sugar/Gluten Free, Support Sleep, Calm & Stress Relief, Vegan, Non-GMO, 30 Servings
features: USDA Organic Calming Kava: An Herbal Blend to Help Achieve Homeostasis! If you’d like to help promote feelings of calmness and relaxation, this blend of 8 herbs may help. Ease stress and promote relaxation with this herbal blend including nervine and adaptogenic herbs. | Multiple Benefits: Kava Kava Root has been found to help with feelings of calm, as well as Skullcap Herb and Hops Flower. Additionally, California Poppy Flower and Passionflower Leaf may have sleep supporting effects. Lastly, this herbal blend includes traditionally-used Anise Seed, Schisandra Berry and Licorice Root. | Vegan Formula: Per Serving (1 mL): Kava Kava (Piper methysticum) Root, California Poppy (Eschscholzia californica) Flower, Hops (Humulus lupulus) Flower, Skullcap (scutellaria lateriflora) Herb, Passionflower (Passiflora incarnata) Leaf, Schisandra (Schisandra chinensis) Berry, Anise (Pimpinella anisum) Seed, Licorice (Glycyrrhiza glabra) Root. Other Ingredients: Organic Glycerin, Purified Water. | Easy-to-Take Liquid Drops: USDA Organic Calming Kava can be taken directly by mouth or added to water. Shake well before use. Take up to 30 drops (1 mL) 1 to 3 times a day, or as recommended by a physician or healthcare professional. Each bottle comes with 30 servings. | For Most Lifestyles: USDA Organic, Non-GMO, Vegan, Made in a GMP Facility. Dairy Free, Nut Free, Gluten & Wheat Free, Soy Free, Corn Free, Sugar Free, No Synthetic or Artificial Colors, Alcohol Free Tincture.
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2024
review_body: I love this stuff! I used it to take the edge off when I quit smoking cigarettes two years ago. I quit cold turkey. Worked like a dream - no stress, no edgy crazy, and zero relapse. I picked this product back up again a few months ago when I was having some stressful times at work and it was just as useful. Will purchase again for sure!

review_title: Tastes gross not sure it does much
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 24, 2024
review_body: This tastes like dirt on its own. I’ve put it in sugar free Gatorade a couple times which is better. I’ve had this the past three nights and I cannot say I notice much of anything. review_title: Kava Can Be Addicting, That Should Be on the Labeling
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2024
review_body: I learned that Kava can be an addicting substance and that information is not listed on this supplement. It's not purely kava, so perhaps that's why there does not need to be a disclaimer. Aside from that, after using two bottles of this supplement, I did not notice any change in my anxiety. It didn't help me personally. The taste was pretty gross as well. I wouldn't spend my money on this supplement again.

review_title: Nice Lucid Dreams - Deeper Sleep - And Fall Asleep Faster!
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2022
review_body: The ingredient blend in this sleep aid is pretty unique as few have 100mg of California Poppy Extract. This also has the very relaxing Lemon Balm at 100mg and the reliable Chamomile Flower Powder at 50mg. Melatonin is only 2mg and Valerian 500mg. L-Tryptophan comes in at 500mg and GABA at 500mg.You take two capsules before bed with a glass of water.My experience was that this blend helped me go to sleep faster - I lay down and was out for the count. I slept deeper and woke up a little dreamy. I did have some unique lucid dreams which were very interesting.I'll take these anytime I need to have reliable sleep patterns and want to enjoy a few beautiful vivid dreams.As someone who takes a lot of different sleep pills to get a good night's rest I think these are some of the best I've tried.~The Rebecca Review

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2022
review_body: The product description states that these are gluten-free, dairy-free, and non-GMO. It's also apparently free of any ingredients that work.I'd gladly take whatever animal products they left out, a glass of milk, and genetic modifications that'd do Mendel proud if this product actually worked as advertised. At the suggested dosage, it did absolutely nothing to help me fall asleep, or stay asleep. Mind you, this was also after watching my intake of sugar, caffeine, and chocolate during the day, staying off my phone before bed (blue light wreaks havoc on sleep cycles), and making sure the TV was off, so it's not like it can be blamed on factors having nothing to do with the product.Having gotten this as a Vine item, I'm merely disappointed; I can see being somewhat more than disappointed had I paid full price.

review_title: Finally a sleep aid that works
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2022
review_body: I haven’t been able to sleep for almost 2 years now. I have a 13 month old and well….. you get the picture. She’s at the age now to where she sleeps throughout the night but mamas still having a hard time getting a full nights sleep. I can’t even remember the last time I had an actual dream, I’d probably wake up scared if I did. For the last couple nights I’ve been taking 2 of these snooze pills an hour before bed time. The last two nights I closed my eyes, tossed and turned for about 20 minutes (amazing for me) and then I woke up to the baby crying in the morning. I actually slept throughout the night. I didn’t even wake up when my husband got up. He’s extremely quiet but I’m such a light sleeper. I woke up feeling good too. No grogginess. It was like I didn’t even take sleeping aids the night before. I would give these 5 stars but they’re really expensive. So, they get 4 stars due to being too pricy for most of us to afford. 3 capsules is the suggested amount to take. That means this $50 bottle would get you 20 nights of rest. I took 2 capsules to stretch it out to 30 days.

review_title: Did not work so well for me.

review_body: This product comes in a very cute box with a magnetic closure.  It's packets are well sealed and each dose is individually wrapped for convenience. Second night I sleep a little more but I was not getting the rest I needed.  Some sleeping supplements can cause me to have nightmares but these did not when I was asleep.  Anyway...I wish I could 100% suggest these for those who suffer from insomnia.  It helps but not enough.  Maybe after a long time of use it might work but for now I will have to continue using my prescription from my doctor and having my scary dreams.

review_title: Worked well but too expensive for daily use
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
review_body: The bottle came with cellophane wrapping on the outside and the inner seal was intact to ensure it hasn't been tampered with. review_title: Wow! Best Sleep Supplement I've Tried
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2023
review_body: I was so surprised the first time I took this Abundant Earth Sleep Aid. It hit me so fast! Truth be told, I had had a glass of wine AND I took it with Melatonin. Whoa! I almost couldn't get upstairs to bed fast enough - my head hit the pillow hard!The next night, I had a glass of wine again, but skipped the Melatonin. Yes - I didn't have to rush right to bed quite as quickly, but still - wow! Did I sleep well!The third night I tried it without a glass of wine. I fell asleep and stayed asleep. This stuff is great.Let me tell you what I've had to take to go to sleep before trying this Minding Down supplement:1) Qunol Sleep Support 5 in 12) 15 mg Melatonin3) CBD (which I quit taking two months ago)4) I sleep with several palm stones in my bed. I have to hold stones in my hands or I can't sleep (something to try if you're desperate to sleep, but can't. Try amethyst, rose quartz, malachite, or selenite.)5) Theta wave binaural sleep music6) A humidifierNow it's just Minding Down and the palm stones (and the music and the humidifier - gotta have those). I can't believe how well this supplement works. Glycine! It also has other benefits, like it regulates your hormones, helps with digestion, and it's supposed to be good for your bones. What a winner! I'll keep taking this!

review_title: Tastes like cough medicine and doesn't have any noticeable relaxing effects.
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2024
review_body: Bought this as a supplement to unwind after a long day and feel ready for bed a bit earlier than i tend to get to bed but unfortunately it didn't do anything and the taste was terrible. I tend to feel very wired after i get back from the office and it prevents me from getting to bed at the hour that I would prefer, so i was very hopeful that this could be the solution as I don't drink during the week.  Not only was it not enjoyable to drink but it had zero effect on my mood or my state of relaxation. I'm not sure what I'm missing from the people raving about it on the reviews but perhaps its a bit of a placebo effect for some?  I find much better results from taking Ashwagandha and Kava Tea and/or melatonin.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2024
review_body: Interesting flavor, not really a replacement for wine. I usually take melatonin to sleep and I tried this instead one night. Didn’t work as well as melatonin but still helped a little I think. Still an interesting drink for the evening instead of wine/cocktail

brand: Apothékary Wine Down Herbal Supplement, Alcohol-Free Red Wine-Inspired Tincture, Sugar Free, Gluten Free, Vegan- 30 Servings- 1.23oz

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2024
review_body: This product has a significant impact on putting me to sleep. 15 drops (3/4 serving) gets me ready to pass out in about 30-45 minutes. I have always been a good sleeper once asleep, but my smart watch is showing I'm sleeping deeper than normal since I started taking the product. So as a sleep aid it has been phenomenal.I need to take about a serving and a half (30 ish drops) to feel the tension relief in my muscles, and then I almost sleep too hard and have a harder time waking up in the morning. A non alcoholic hangover if you would? hahaI feel better in other ways too but it is hard to separate if I feel better because of the product or because I'm not drinking alcohol before bed.My skin looks great, mood is improved, focus is good. All the things.People complain about the price point, and yes, for 1.2 oz $30 seems steep, but if you figure it replaces one alcoholic drink a night, it's already breaking even or saving you money.I put it in a juice and sparkling water drink, and I've never noticed a taste.I'm excited to try their other flavors/versions.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2024
review_body: I started seeing these pop up on my feeds, so of course I was hooked in. I was thrilled to see next day shipping. And waited all day to try the Wine Down. Even forgoing a drink at dinner so I could enjoy this. I excitedly ran to the door when I saw it was delivered but not alerted. When I opened the parcel I was greeted with a damaged Rosé Tinted box.. the Wine Down didn’t look as bad, but had also opened from the bottom.. both of the stabilizing inserts were obviously torn. The little seal was peeled back on both bottles. What a buzz kill..

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2024
review_body: I really really wanted to love this product. I’ve tried it a few times a few different ways. First off it doesn’t taste like wine. It’s not bad mixed with a sparkling drink but to mix it with just water, it’s almost tasteless. I’ve tried it just from the dropper and it doesn’t have a great flavor. I also don’t get any relaxing or any feeling really after trying it. It doesn’t take away the want for a glass of wine. It’s over priced and doesn’t seem to have any benefits that I can tell.

review_title: Not wine, but not NOT wine
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
review_body: As I discovered when I was pregnant, there just is not a substitute for red wine. There are great AF beers and even mocktails, but they just can’t get the flavor of a great cab without the alcohol. Fast forward and I’m just trying to ease back on week day consumption (it’s gained some momentum since 2020) and this is not a bad stand in. It definitely tastes more like an herbal tea than wine, but it’s pleasant. I’m experimenting with adding 2 droppers full to some room temperature sparkling water and a splash of no sugar added cranberry juice. It looks pretty in the glass, tastes ok, and I do feel more relaxed after drinking. I would say if you’re hesitating because of the price, just go for it and play around with how to take it. It’s definitely cheaper than 6 bottles of wine.

features: Dr. Christopher
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2014
review_body: I got this product from the local herbal store for my father. Since then I do believe I have ordered multiple bottles. I ordered one for myself, neighbors, had one sent to my mother, and extra bottles to have on hand. This extract makes using the valerian root more tolerable with the taste and smell while working in the same manner as the root tea, which I have to be totally truthful I still drink the tea version when I have a headache at home. This product has helped my with my father's medical problems. I can NEVER tell you how much it means to know that a loved, is no longer in the pain and that the pain is removed with a herbal product QUICKLY. I watched my father's shaking from pain visible go way in minutes. Everyone that I have told about this product is using it with success on the results.

features: Dr. Christopher
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2022
review_body: I did notice a difference with my sleep and it was better rest than without using this product.  I did however notice that after a few days of use it doesn't work as well as the initial use.  Gradually it becomes ineffective and you get no benefit from it.  If you stop using it for a few days and then try again it will work.This is most effective when used occasionally and not on a daily basis.  Your body will build a tolerance for it and it will not work after a week or two of daily use.  Once every 3 days seems to be the threshold for keeping it effective for myself.  You may find that it works differently for you.I do recommend this.  It did help me sleep well and continues to do so as long as I don't use it daily and only use it occasionally.

review_body: Doesn't have a wonderful taste, but it's not that bad either.  Highly recommend for help with anxiety during the day, or as an addition to other sleep aids at night. I use it for anxiety - particularly test anxiety - it worked wonderfully.

brand: Healthy Gut BeSerene IR | GABA & L-Theanine | 1.9 OZ
name: Healthy Gut BeSerene IR | GABA & L-Theanine | 1.9 OZ
features: BeSerene Instant Relief Cream is a natural supplement that helps you feel calm and is there for you when your thoughts won't stop and your emotions spike- day or night. | Our advanced delivery system is designed to work fast, providing relief in 10 minutes or less. | BeSerene Instant Relief Cream is made with special ingredients like GABA, Mulungu, Albizia Supreme, California Poppy, and L-Theanine, which are all known for their calming effects on the body and mind. | You can apply the cream to your wrists or temples, and it will absorb into your skin to help you feel more at ease. | Works best when used in conjunction with BeSerene Daily for a holistic calming system.
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2024
review_body: I originally bought this for my husband, who responds best to beer as a catalyst for sleep. He has always worked the late shift since he was 15 and recently got an early morning job, so his body isn't adjusting too well. Figuring that it was either the hops or the GABA in the beer that was making him drowsy, I tried making him some herbal tea blends with hops since I had some on-hand. It didn't do anything. So of course, to Amazon!I wasn't searching for a topical product but it aligned with his mentality that pills are bad, so I took a chance on it. Wowow this product W O R K S. Not just for my husband, but for me! I don't have trouble falling asleep, but I don't get good, deep sleep once I'm in that state. This cream fixes that issue completely! I feel so incredibly rested - provided I give myself time for 8 hours.I was sold on one reciew that mentioned they don't even remember falling asleep, and I must say that is exactly my experience as well! I started with 1 pump on my wrists and enjoyed the results, but the best rest comes from applying it to my temples! And I don't need very much when I apply it there compared to my wrists, so it's cost-saving too!If you are unsure on this one, I say take a chance. The worst that can happen is you lose some money, but I think that's better than losing sleep!!

review_body: I'm having a hard time getting over the price of $35 for this small pump bottle.I haven't felt much difference, to be honest.I take it and then wait for something and generally nothing different is felt.It could be subtle, I admit.But should you feel something more dramatic at $35 for less than 2 ounces?You don't eat it, you rub it on your skin.That sounded promising. I mean, our skin is our largest organ, right?I tried hard to let it work but nothing transpired.Maybe I got a dud bottle or something. I dunno.But I felt nothing.

brand: Healthy Gut BeSerene IR | GABA & L-Theanine | 1.9 OZ
name: Healthy Gut BeSerene IR | GABA & L-Theanine | 1.9 OZ
features: BeSerene Instant Relief Cream is a natural supplement that helps you feel calm and is there for you when your thoughts won't stop and your emotions spike- day or night. | Our advanced delivery system is designed to work fast, providing relief in 10 minutes or less. | BeSerene Instant Relief Cream is made with special ingredients like GABA, Mulungu, Albizia Supreme, California Poppy, and L-Theanine, which are all known for their calming effects on the body and mind. | You can apply the cream to your wrists or temples, and it will absorb into your skin to help you feel more at ease. | Works best when used in conjunction with BeSerene Daily for a holistic calming system.
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 10, 2024
review_body: This is a review for Healthy Gut Be Serene.I ordered this out of curiosity. I didn't believe that a cream could help you destress and relax or even help you get back to sleep. I was almost afraid to try it just in case it was true! So I did the safest thing possible, I used half the dosage before bedtime. As I sat in bed reading for a few minutes as I always do I was overcome by a feeling of "end of the day" relief. I never finished reading that page. In the morning, I found my book on the floor. I never have sleep problems but that night I had barely been in bed a few minutes before my lights went out and that was on half a dose. At the next opportunity I got brave and used a half dose in the middle of the day. It felt like i had a midday pause for a cup of tea! It did not make me sleepy but I did feel renewed and less stressed to continue the rest of the day.  From that point I experimented with dosing depending on how stressed I was feeling.I like the idea of a topical cream. I can keep it in my purse and not worry it's going to spill like liquid drops. HealthyGut products are non GMO, they have no fillers and they use a cGMP facility. However, I don't see information about 3rd party lab testing. In my opinion that is probably the most important certification. you can have. Lastly, unfortunately these supplements from Healthy Gut are very overpriced especially lacking some important certifications.  That really limits the customer base who will no doubt go elsewhere until they find an answer as the founders did in their 'story'. I am not so sure I will order this again but I can definitely recommend this "Be Serene Cream"

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 16, 2024
review_body: If you have trouble taking melatonin as I do this product seems to relax your mind and body allowing you to fall asleep and stay asleep for hours.GABA is known to help with sleep as is l-theanine and this easy to apply cream has both plus California poppy and other ingredients meant to calm a racing mind. It is very lightly scented and I have had no negative effects from the cream ingredients (there is a lengthy list of ingredients). I apply it about an hour before I want to fall asleep although the instructions suggest ten minutes.I wish it wasn’t as expensive as it is but, in the end, you pay for what you get. This cream calms your mind allowing you to fall asleep and restore your senses without using melatonin. It would be a great aid for those who have daytime anxiety because it is so easy to use.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2024
review_body: So it definitely does something. I am giving it three stars for that. I was having a stressed out moment this morning from family where I literally felt like that Scream face painting, and I decided to try a pump's worth on my inner arm. The cream is an opaque brown color like a coffee with creamer. It is not oily and seems to absorb quickly without irritation, though stings very, very slightly (I am guessing from alcohol content in it and I have baby sensitive skin; on regular skin it is probably not noticeable). I appreciate there is no added fragrance or perfumes. I did experience palpitations about 15 minutes after I put it on, and I never usually get those. It may be that I should have used less than a full pump as I am a petite woman at 125 lbs. Be careful if you are sensitive, and test first with a small dot, to ensure it is suitable for you.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2024
review_body: I love the choice of ingredients and the fact that it’s certified organic too. It’s fairly easy to take (2 dropperfuls once to three times a day) but it’s hard for me to get a “full” dropper.  It fills up about 3/4 of the way no matter how I angle the bottle and position the dropper.  And there’s no line or indicator to show how full it needs to be.  However, since they say you can take it up to 3x a day I guess you don’t have to be too cautious about overdosing.  The taste is also a little strong for me personally — the thyme really is prominent in this.  I am used to herbal supplements and normally don’t have any issues with weird concoctions but with this one I’d have to get used to it.  I was able to do one dropper of it without mixing into anything but I think I’ll try hiding it in a tart juice, but it’s such a strange combination of flavors I’m not sure I could stand drinking it in a full cup of juice.  In a pinch I would use this but I think I’d prefer a pill or just a simple elderberry gummy instead.  Just my preference anyway.  Otherwise the product itself is clean and seems to be an excellent way to boost your immune system when necessary.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2024
review_body: This item is a 30ml amber bottle of organic herb tincture that is plant based and formulated to provide immunity support. The bottle includes an eye dropper cap that is used to deliver the recommended 2 dropper full of the liquid. The ingredients includes extracts of echinacea, elderberry, thyme, sage, yarrow, and lemon balm in a proprietary combination. The claim is that this tincture will support a healthy immune system and provide a defense against seasonal threats that can make you ill, per the product description. I'm familiar with all the ingredients, but feel that there are minerals and vitamins that should be added to the mix to boost immunity. The liquid tastes quite bad so I recommend adding the 2 dropper full to some juice. I appreciate that it's made in the USA. I find the price point for 20 days supply to be rather steep. Overall, it's not a bad tincture to add to your daily supplement regiment, but it's not something I will continue to use given I have other more cost effective immunity support supplements.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2024
review_body: Not entirely sure how great of a benefit one gets from the Qat listed here instead of the actual qat used in places like Yemen, but this stuff does not have any acute effects that you will notice immediately. Most importantly, if you're very sensitive to taste, this is definitely one of those "acquired tastes" products, but I generally liked it and thought it was pleasant enough after the initial use. Might have benefits over time, but hard to tell.

name: Apothékary Wine Down Herbal Supplement, Alcohol-Free Red Wine-Inspired Tincture, Sugar Free, Gluten Free, Vegan- 100 Servings- 4.07oz
description: CLINICAL HERBALIST-CRAFTED FORMULA FOR STRESS, IMMUNITY, AND SLEEP*: Made with potent herbs used for centuries and proven by science to help calm feelings of stress and tension, support the immune system, and soothe you to sleep.
features: ALL NATURAL & ORGANIC INGREDIENTS: Featuring powerful herbs like California poppy, blue vervain, and tart cherry. | Combined with elderberry and hawthorn berry which provide antioxidants that support the body’s natural immune response. | HOW TO: Drop ½ to 1 full-dropper under the tongue for faster tension support or add to a glass of sparkling water, juice, or mocktail for hours of rest and relaxation. | 100 SERVINGS: One full dropper each day for over three months to support the body’s immune system | THIRD-PARTY TESTED: Wine Down is third-party tested for quality and efficacy.
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2024
review_body: i’m glad i got this “wine down” relaxation supplement, but i can’t tell if it has much of an effect on me for promoting sleep.  it arrived safely sealed, and the expiry date on the bottle is a year and a half away.  i like that it comes in a glass bottle with a dropper, and the ingredients seem good.  i’ve taken it a few times and had no bad reaction.  the taste is really mild when i mix it with water.  when i put it directly on or under my tongue, i find the taste pleasant, slightly sweet and herbal, with no aftertaste.  this is currently listed for $89 for 4oz, which makes it rather pricey.  there are many lower-cost similarly effective supplements available that i would buy rather than this, but if this is within your budget, i would suggest trying out their smaller bottle.

features: ALL NATURAL & ORGANIC INGREDIENTS: Featuring powerful herbs like California poppy, blue vervain, and tart cherry. | Combined with elderberry and hawthorn berry which provide antioxidants that support the body’s natural immune response. | HOW TO: Drop ½ to 1 full-dropper under the tongue for faster tension support or add to a glass of sparkling water, juice, or mocktail for hours of rest and relaxation. | 100 SERVINGS: One full dropper each day for over three months to support the body’s immune system | THIRD-PARTY TESTED: Wine Down is third-party tested for quality and efficacy.
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2024
review_body: The Apothekary Wine Down is an herbal liquid tincture supplement that is inspired by red wine. It has a bold, flavorful taste and is made with high-quality organic ingredients such as poppy from California, blue vervain, tart cherry, elderberry, and hawthorn. It has a bold flavor that is described as sweet and fruity, with a mild cinnamon undertone. The supplement comes in a 4.07oz bottle and has 100 servings.Overall, the Apothekary Wine Down is a natural supplement that can help individuals unwind and prepare for a restful night's sleep. Its unique blend of herbal extracts and lack of common allergens make it an attractive option for those looking for a safe and effective way to relax and improve sleep quality.I have to admit that when I first heard about Apothekary Wine Down, I was a bit skeptical about its claims of being "wine replacement" and promoting relaxation and improving sleep quality. I've tried other supplements in the past that promised similar benefits, but ultimately fell short of delivering on their promises. However, after giving Wine Down a try for several nights in a row, I was pleasantly surprised by how well it worked. I like the flavor and easy-to-take formula made it a breeze to incorporate into my bedtime routine, and I found myself feeling more relaxed and calm than usual. I noticed that I was sleeping better and waking up feeling more refreshed, which was a great bonus. While I still approach supplements with a healthy dose of skepticism, I have to say that Apothekary Wine Down has won me over - it's definitely a product that I would recommend to others looking for a natural way to unwind and improve their sleep. My only "complaint" is a steep price. But if you break it down per dose, it's definitely cheaper than wine :)

name: Apothékary Wine Down Herbal Supplement, Alcohol-Free Red Wine-Inspired Tincture, Sugar Free, Gluten Free, Vegan- 100 Servings- 4.07oz

review_title: Not sure how effective this is
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2024
review_body: I am someone who drinks wine, and sometimes likes to WINE DOWN with wine, and who is also in an area where weed is legal and sometimes like to WEED DOWN to sleep.  This has a high bar to clear.  First the packaging.  This is a well packaged product with a sturdy and secure box and a very strong container for the actual liquid.  The dropper is also nice and easy to use.  The liquid itself has a very sweet taste with an herbal tinge, which makes sense given the ingredient list.I used this a couple of times, always opting for the first delivery method: placing a droppers worth of liquid under/on my tongue for 10 seconds.In all cases I was able to sleep, and I would even categorize my sleep as "fine" or "restful" but I do not know how much this expensive tincture contributed to it.  I can say that one thing I did notice is that my dreams were much weirder when I took this.Be careful with this I guess, its very pricey.

review_title: no noticeable difference after using this supplement
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2024
review_body: My husband and I have both tried this wine down herbal supplement.  He put a full dropper under his tongue as recommended and hated the taste.  He said it tastes similar to cough syrup.  I preferred to try it mixed with sparkling water.  My sparkling water is already slightly flavored, so even with 2 full droppers mixed with 12 ounces of water, I didn't really notice a taste difference.  It was good to me, but again it was mostly sparkling water which I enjoy.  I have to say neither one of us really noticed anything different.  We both took this supplement at night, when we were probably already a bit tired and relaxed, so I cannot tell if it had any kind of noticeable effect.  For that reason, I can't really recommend this due to the high cost.  Maybe it works on some, but I would have to be very sure before spending a lot of money.

review_title: I love Wine Down to wind down ;)
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2024
review_body: After taking Apothekary's Wine Down for about a week, never in my life have I thought I'd say something like this, but this tincture tastes like autumn to me (even though I began taking it in summer ;). And this tincture, when it touches my tongue, spreads a wonderful taste over it- and a quick moment later, there is a slow burn that begins and remains for a bit after.Wine Down comes in a lovely dark white colored glass bottle (not see through, white glass) with a dropper attached to the cap. Both the bottle and dropper are glass and both, the very best quality. The directions tell you to squeeze one drop on or under the tongue and let sit for ten seconds. If you don't like the taste however, you can put it in a drink. You are told in these directions you can take this tincture up to four times a day.When I took Wine Down, I felt the effects quickly- within a couple minutes, and in all honesty, it does have a very good calming effect. It worked so well I took to taking it with me during the day and taking it when I needed to relax. I wouldn't  say Wine Down is terribly intense though, it's just something that actually helped me to relax- as if before I couldn't quote catch my breath and after- well, there was no longer that problem.Wine Down is something that I will definitely be using in the future, because, for me, there were so many positive effects- not only did the tincture relax me but when I took it before bed, it also helped to get me to sleep better- during my “wind down” time (and now this is my “Wine Down” time ;).I am really in love with this product, I don't go anywhere without it (just in case I need it) and have never been so happy to have chosen this product to review on Amazon as- it would have never been something that I tried on my own!

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2024
review_body: This product was very intriguing as I am always chasing a good, restful night's sleep. This was the first product I have seen of this type. It is easy to take and had a fruit-like flavor. Slightly sweet, but not overpowering. Effect wise, I would rate this a 3.5, rounded up to 4. Value-wise, it is on the expensive side, especially because I usually wind up taking 2 doses compared to the recommended one dose. I do feel more relaxed after taking, but can't say 100% if it helps me get a deeper/more relaxing sleep. It would be nice to offer in a trial size so you could see how well it works before committing to the full size.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2024
review_body: The first time I tried it (sublingual), I sorta felt relaxed, but not like a buzz from drinking.  Don't get me wrong, after a long week, feeling relaxed is a big perk.  I waited a few days before trying it again and had zero affect.  Was on an empty stomach, but figured maybe it should be a once a week treat. Waited a week and tried it again, nothing.  Waited another week and took 1.5 of the droppers to see if I simply needed more, still nothing.  This led me to believe that I either had a placebo affect or ingredients just don't affect me.  Either way, I was disappointed because I was hoping for an addition to add to my rotation of some other products I use.  For the price, I could order 2 of my other supplements that work.

review_title: Not sure I am getting any effect from it
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2024
review_body: The first time I used it (sublingual), I thought it worked and I was about as relaxed as a glass of red wine. But since then, whether I put it in a glass of fizzy water or under my tongue before TV (or bed) I haven't noticed much effect. The flavour is not bad at all: slightly sweet...slightly berry. And I have done a bit of research on all the ingredients. I would try another variety.The bottle is really heavy (quite nice). I will probably reuse it for something else. The packaging attractive. I need to try it for longer to be sure (using it now for two weeks) but for me it has helped decreasing alcohol consumption. It might for you too.

review_title: Keto-approved! It works and no extra carbs!
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 16, 2018
review_body: I love this stuff. As a pediatric nurse, I take numerous measures to make sure I stay well and don’t bring any illnesses to my patients. One of those measures is a daily dose of high dose elderberry. I used to take Sambucus Immune, but I’ve recently started the keto diet and that particular liquid formula has 8 carbs per serving, so it’s a no go for me (but my daughter stays well on it)! This product is the highest strength I’ve found available in capsule form. I’ve been taking this product over 30 days and during that time, I’ve been in close quarters with several people with viruses like norovirus (stomach flu) and only once did I feel just a little queasy for one afternoon. I took a double dose that night and the next morning I felt at 100%. After that, I go ahead and double up when I’m knowingly around someone sick. Ultimately, I’m very pleased with this product and highly recommend it to anyone.

review_title: I recommend this to all my family and friends if they ...
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2015
review_body: Black elderberry from GAIA is the real thing. I recommend this to all my family and friends if they are getting sick. I take it every time I feel like I am "coming down with something" and within 24 hours I am completely better!  It is great to take daily to keep from getting sick during the winter when lots of viruses and such are going around. I even opened up the capsule and poured into some food for my 4 year old when she was sick with a bad cold and she felt better that same day. I 100% stand behind this product from GAIA.  It's also good for those with allergies and can help minimize symptoms if taken daily or reduce the need for allergy medicine.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2017
review_body: ** UPDATED FOR JUNE 2017, scroll down to read ** Bought twice. The first time I ordered a bottle I got Liquid Phyto-Capsules, the second time I ordered I recived capsules that seemed to either have powder in them or the liquid has dried up. The date on the bottle says 10/19, so I'm pretty sure they're not expired. I've been taking them like I normally would, but it's just...odd, because I know they're not supposed to look like this (unless they've changed?). I will still order these, I'm just confused. Hopefully I won't get sick or anything, I have 34 capsules left and I take two every morning.UPDATE: 6/12/17So I ordered another bottle a few days ago and received the bottle, to which on the box it stated that it was a new and improved formula. The capsules looked exactly like the ones that inspired me to write this review, they looked like the capsules in the picture. So the company finally got around to making it official that they changed the formula, on the box. I can't say for sure if this new formula works better than the old one, as I was sure that they were onto something with the liquid inside the capsule. Oh well. I ordered the elderberry syrup as well (not the nighttime one) and I take that sometimes when I need the extra help and want the benefits of having the liquid. So I guess just be aware that there's the change to the formula. Too bad they couldn't have just made another version of this capsule and kept this one with liquid inside. But I guess they know what they're doing.

Black Elderberry helps maintain a healthy immune response.* Black Elderberry is unique in providing both antioxidant and immune support due to its natural concentration of Anthocyanins and other flavonoids.* This Black Elderberry product is just as concentrated as our best-selling syrup, in the convenience of a capsule for immune support on the go.* Made with Black Elderberries and Acerola fruit for synergistic immune support, this product contains no sweeteners or fillers.* For additional immune support, try our Black Elderberry Syrup and Black Elderberry NightTime Syrup.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2020
review_body: We had been suffering with the congestion and stuff that has been going around, for two months. We just couldn't shake it until we started taking this. We doubled up on it at first, then went down to a regular everyday dose once the symptoms started to subside. I definitely recommend it!

review_title: recommended this to us two years ago and since then ...
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2015
review_body: My friend's twin sister, a midwife, recommended this to us two years ago and since then it's helped boost my immunity to every sniffle that comes around, and has made my allergies more manageable. I love this stuff. There's an increasing amount of scientific literature proving the efficacy of elderberry extract in immunity boosting. Amazon has the best prices on Gaia (60 for the price of 30 at Whole Foods), and the capsules are easy to swallow, whereas the syrup is very, very sweet and can be off putting. All of that being said, after six months of ordering it, I have to share this photo of the packaging to shame Amazon into a less wasteful shipping method. The box of capsules in a bubble wrap lined envelope would work just as well.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2020
review_body: I have hot it for immune support by my chiropractor's recommendation. It is amazing! I have not the strongest immune system and it helped me to stay healthy through the flu season. If you feel like you are getting sick, go for 2 in the morning and evening. If you feel ok. 1 in the morning and evening is good enough. I also prefer this version instead of chewing ones, because it has no sugar.

review_title: I don't feel any better. Nor worse. I haven't been sick, though. So... maybe they do help?
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2021
review_body: I've been taking these for quite some time. I honestly don't know if they help any. I don't feel any better. Nor worse. I haven't been sick, though. So... maybe they do help? I used to make my own elderberry syrup for years, but got tired of it as I couldn't deal with all the sweetness of the honey. I am not big on sweets. It was a torture taking it. ( And alcohol tincture bothered my stomach. ) So I decided to try these. It is easier to take. And not sweet. Nor it upsets my stomach. I like to think they do help keeping my immune system strong and in perfect working order.

review_title: Who knew the benefits of black elderberry....
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2017
review_body: I have an autoimmune disease called Sarcoidosis that affects my lungs.  I get a lot of mucus build up and non-stop episodes of coughing.  On a whim, I was doing some Google-ing and found the recommendation for black elderberry.  I of course headed over to my favorite store (Amazon) and found the Gaia capsules, ordered a bottle to give them a try.  Wow!  They seem work almost instantaneously to break up the mucus and help to suppress the coughing.  I don't need to take them every day but I have reordered them twice and will continue to order to keep them in my cabinet.

brand: BareOrganics Sweet Dreams Liquid Drops, Herbal Sleep Aid, 1 Ounce
name: BareOrganics Sweet Dreams Liquid Drops, Herbal Sleep Aid, 1 Ounce
description: Sweet Dreams Liquid Drops blend organic ingredients in an herbal sleep aid that help quiet the mind to support restful sleep. BareOrganics Sweet Dreams Drops are made with organic Valerian, Skullcap, Hops, Passion Flower, California Poppy and Chamomile for optimal wellness support. These liquid valerian drops are available in a compact vial and do not need to be refrigerated, making them ideal for those with active, on-the-go lifestyles. The BareOrganics Liquid Drops are developed without harsh chemicals or ingredients, and are proudly USDA Organic, Non-GMO, Kosher and Gluten & Alcohol-Free. This herbal supplement comes in a 1 ounce recyclable dropper bottle. The drops should be shaken before each use.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
review_body: Didn't do anything for me. The dropper never worked right either, wouldn't fill all the way up.  I tried taking 2 and even 3 doses, didn't feel like these drops made me sleepy at all.  Taste was pretty awful too, kind of earthy, always had to drink something after to wash it down, and it took more than water to do so.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2023
review_body: My little boy has inattentive-type ADHD and struggles to control his impulses and do really any of his work in school. I give him Brahmi every morning and evening, and it really does help. We've taken him off the Brahmi for periods and experimented with some other supplements. So far, Brahmi has been the best. I notice a moderate to large difference when he is not taking it vs when he is.
